## Code Review Summary

Reviewed PR #60: feat: Web Dashboard Shell (Next.js 16, Tailwind v4, Discord OAuth2)

### Overall Assessment

This is a well-structured implementation of a Next.js 16 web dashboard with Discord OAuth2. The architecture follows modern best practices with proper separation of concerns, defense-in-depth auth patterns, and comprehensive test coverage.

### Findings

| Severity | Count | Description |
|----------|-------|-------------|
| ðŸ”´ Critical | 0 | None found |
| ðŸŸ¡ Warning | 1 | Implicit type cast in API route |
| ðŸ”µ Nitpick | 4 | Minor improvements for robustness |

### Notable Strengths (for context, not praise)

- Defense-in-depth auth: proxy.ts + server-side layout check
- Open redirect prevention in login page
- Rate limit handling with retry logic
- 80% coverage threshold enforced
- Security headers in next.config.ts
- Proper `server-only` import guards

### Verdict

The findings are all minor (1 warning, 4 nitpicks). No critical security issues, architectural problems, or blocking concerns. The implementation is production-ready.

---
*Reviewed by Claude Code*



--

If not important (marketing, newsletters, spam, test emails from himself, Google security alerts about new sign-ins/devices, GitHub PR comments/reviews/CI notifications), reply NO_REPLY. SKIP all Google Security Alert emails. SKIP all GitHub notification emails about PR comments, reviews, code review requests, CI/CD status, and issue comments. Auto-track any package tracking numbers with 17TRACK.
